page.title: 06continued
page.content: When he was a child all farming was done by horse and plough. The farmers grew vegetables in summer and went out shrimping in winter, however, if shrimping was paying well in the summer, vegetables would be neglected. (Some Banks families still go shrimping off the coast at Lytham and shell, cook, and pot at home as a cottage industry.) The main hobbies when he was young were shooting and fishing, both still popular in the area. Mr. Fazakerly's hobby nowadays is carving wood. He sometimes sells the carvings at local fairs.
